statements.name: PROC TEXTMINE
statements.description: The TEXTMINE procedure integrates natural language processing and statistical analysis to analyze largescale textual data in SAS Viya. PROC TEXTMINE supports a wide range of fundamental text analysis features, which include tokenizing, stemming, part-of-speech tagging, noun group extraction, default or customized stop lists and start lists, entity parsing, multiword tokens, synonym lists, term weighting, termby- document matrix creation, and dimension reduction by term filtering and singular value decomposition (SVD).

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the input data table for PROC TEXTMINE to use. The default is the most recently created data table. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: LANGUAGE=
arguments.description: Names the language that is used by the documents in the input SAS data table. Languages supported in the current release are Chinese, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, and Turkish. By default, LANGUAGE=ENGLISH.

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of threads to be used. By default, the number of threads is the same as the number of CPUs on the CAS server.

statements.name: DOC_ID
statements.description: The DOC_ID statement specifies the variable that contains the ID of each document. In the input data table, each row corresponds to one document. The ID of each document must be unique; it can be either a number or a string of characters.

statements.name: PARSE
statements.description: The PARSE statement specifies the options for parsing the input documents and creating the term-bydocument matrix.

arguments.name: CELLWGT=
arguments.description: Specifies how the elements in the term-by-document matrix are weighted. You can specify the following values:

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Weights cells by using the log formulation.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Specifies that no cell weight be applied.

arguments.name: ENTITIES=
arguments.description: Determines whether to use the standard LITI file for entity extraction.

arguments.name: STD
arguments.description: Uses the standard LITI file for entity extraction. A term such as “George W. Bush” is recognized as an entity and given the corresponding entity role and attribute. For this term, the entity role is PERSON and the attribute is Entity. Although the entity is treated as the single term, “george w. bush,” the individual tokens “george,” “w,” and “bush” are also included.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Does not use the standard LITI file for entity extraction.

arguments.name: MULTITERM=
arguments.description: Specifies the inpur SAS data table that contains a list of multiword terms. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: NONOUNGROUPS
arguments.description: Suppresses standard noun group extraction. By default, the TEXTMINE procedure extracts noun groups, returns noun phrases without determiners or prepositions, and (unless the NOSTEMMING option is specified) stems noun group elements.

arguments.name: NOSTEMMING
arguments.description: Suppresses stemming of words. By default, words are stemmed; that is, terms such as “advises” and “advising” are mapped to the parent term “advise.” The TEXTMINE procedure uses dictionary-based stemming (also known as lemmatization).

arguments.name: NOTAGGING
arguments.description: Suppresses tagging of terms. By default, terms are tagged and the TEXTMINE procedure identifies a term’s part of speech based on context clues. The identified part of speech is provided in the Role variable of the OUTTERMS= data table.

arguments.name: OUTCHILD=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain a compressed representation of the sparse term-by-document matrix. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: OUTCONFIG=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain configuration information that is used for the current run of PROC TEXTMINE. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: OUTPARENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain a compressed representation of the sparse term-by-document matrix. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: OUTPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain the position information about the child terms’ occurrences in the document collection. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: OUTTERMS=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain the summary information about the terms in the document collection. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: REDUCEF=
arguments.description: Removes terms that are not in at least n documents. The value of n must be a positive integer. By default, REDUCEF=4.

arguments.name: SHOWDROPPEDTERMS
arguments.description: Includes the terms that have a keep status of N in the OUTTERMS= data table and the OUTCHILD= data table.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data table that contains the terms that are to be kept for the analysis. CAS-libref.datatable is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: STOP=
arguments.description: specifies the input data table that contains the terms to exclude from the analysis. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: SYNONYM=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data table that contains user-defined synonyms to be used in the analysis. CASlibref. data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: TERMWGT=
arguments.description: Specifies how terms are weighted.

arguments.name: ENTROPY
arguments.description: Uses the entropy formulation to weight terms.

arguments.name: MI
arguments.description: Uses the mutual information formulation to weight terms (you must also specify the TARGET statement).

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Requests that no term weight be applied.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: The SELECT statement enables you to specify the parts of speech or entities or attributes that you want to include in or exclude from your analysis. Exclusion by the SELECT statement is different from exclusion that is indicated by the _keep variable in the OUTTERMS= data table. Terms that are excluded by the SELECT statement cannot be included in the OUTTERMS= data table, whereas terms that have _keep=N can be included in the OUTTERMS= data table if the SHOWDROPPEDTERMS option is specified. Terms excluded by the SELECT statement are excluded from the OUTPOS= data table, but terms that have _keep=N are included in OUTPOS= data table. label-list specifies one or more labels that are either parts of speech or entities or attributes. Each label must be surrounded by double quotation marks and separated by spaces from other labels. Labels are case-insensitive. Terms that have these labels are either ignored during parsing (when the IGNORE option is specified) or kept in the parsing results in the OUTPOS= and OUTTERMS= data tables (when the KEEP option is specified).

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the labels are attributes, entities, or parts of speech. The group type must be surrounded by double quotation marks and is case-insensitive. All labels that are specified in the label-list in the same SELECT statement should belong to the specified group. If you need to select labels from more than one group, you can use multiple SELECT statements (one for each group that you need to select from). You cannot specify multiple SELECT statements for the same group. By default, “Num” and “Punct” in the “ATTRIBUTES” group are ignored, but this default is overridden by a SELECT statement that specifies GROUP=“ATTRIBUTES”. By default, GROUP=“POS”.

arguments.name: "ATTRIBUTES"
arguments.description: Specifies that labels are attributes.

arguments.name: "ENTITIES"
arguments.description: Specifies that labels are entities.

arguments.name: "POS"
arguments.description: Specifies that labels are parts of speech (POS).

arguments.name: IGNORE
arguments.description: Ignores during parsing all terms whose labels are specified in the label-list, but keeps all other terms in the parsing results (the OUTPOS= and OUTTERMS= data tables).

arguments.name: KEEP
arguments.description: Keeps in the parsing results (the OUTPOS= and OUTTERMS= data tables) only the terms whose labels are specified in the label-list.

statements.name: SVD
statements.description: The SVD statement specifies the options for calculating a truncated singular value decomposition (SVD) of the large, sparse term-by-document matrix that is created during the parsing phase of PROC TEXTMINE.

arguments.name: COL=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable that contains the column indices of the term-by-document matrix. You must specify this option when you run PROC TEXTMINE in SVD-only mode (that is, when you specify the SVD statement but not the PARSE statement).

arguments.name: ENTRY=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable that contains the entries of the term-by-document matrix. You must specify this option when you run PROC TEXTMINE in SVD-only mode (that is, when you specify the SVD statement but not the PARSE statement).

arguments.name: EXACTWEIGHT
arguments.description: Requests that the weights aggregated during topic derivation not be rounded. By default, the calculated weights are rounded to the nearest 0.001.

arguments.name: IN_TERMS=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data table that contains information about the terms in the document collection. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table

arguments.name: K=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns in the matrices U, V, and S. This value is the number of dimensions of the data table after SVD is performed. If the value of k is too large, then the TEXTMINE procedure runs for an unnecessarily long time. This option takes precedence over the MAX_K= option. This option also controls the number of topics that are extracted from the text corpus when the ROTATION= option is specified.

arguments.name: MAX_K=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum value that the TEXTMINE procedure should return as the recommended value of k (the number of columns in the matrices U, V, and S) when the RESOLUTION= option is specified (to recommend the value of k). The TEXTMINE procedure attempts to calculate k dimensions (as opposed to recommending it) when it performs SVD. This option is ignored if the K= option has been specified. This option also controls the number of topics that are extracted from the text corpus when the ROTATION= option is specified.

arguments.name: NOCUTOFFS
arguments.description: Uses all weights in the U matrix to form the document projections. When topics are requested, weights below the term cutoff (as calculated in the OUTTOPICS= data table) are set to 0 before the projection is formed.

arguments.name: NUMLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of terms to use in the descriptive label for each topic. The descriptive label provides a quick synopsis of the discovered topics. The labels are stored in the OUTTOPICS= data table. By default, NUMLABELS=5.

arguments.name: OUTDOCPRO=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain the projections of the columns of the term-by-document matrix onto the columns of U. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: OUTTOPICS=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain the topics that are discovered. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: RESOLUTION=
arguments.description: Specifies how to calculate the recommended number of dimensions (resolution) for the singular value decomposition. If you specify this option, you must also specify the MAX_K= option. A lowresolution singular value decomposition returns fewer dimensions than a high-resolution singular value decomposition. This option recommends the value of k (the number of columns in the matrices U, V, and S) heuristically based on the value specified in the MAX_K= option. Assume that the MAX_K= option is set to n and a singular value decomposition that has n dimensions accounts for t% of the total variance.

arguments.name: LOW
arguments.description: Recommends a k that explains (2/3) * t% of the total variance.

arguments.name: MED
arguments.description: Recommends a k that explains (5/6) * t% of the total variance.

arguments.name: HIGH
arguments.description: Always recommends the maximum number of dimensions; that is, k = n.

arguments.name: ROTATION=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of rotation to be used in order to maximize the explanatory power of each topic.

arguments.name: VARIMAX
arguments.description: Does an orthogonal rotation on the original left singular vectors and generates uncorrelated topics.

arguments.name: PROMAX
arguments.description: Does an oblique rotation on the original left singular vectors and generates topics that might be correlated.

arguments.name: ROW=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable that contains the row indices of the term-by-document matrix. You must specify this option when you run PROC TEXTMINE in SVD-only mode (that is, when you specify the SVD statement but not the PARSE statement).

arguments.name: SVDS=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data table to contain the calculated singular values. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: SVDU=
arguments.description: Specifies the data table to contain the calculated left singular vectors. CAS-libref.data-table is a twolevel name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: SVDV=
arguments.description: Specifies the data table to contain the calculated right singular vectors. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: TOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum allowable tolerance for the singular value.

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: This statement specifies the variable that contains the information about the category that a document belongs to. The target variable can be any nominal or ordinal variable; it is used in calculating mutual information term weighting.

statements.name: VARIABLES
statements.description: This statement specifies the variable that contains the text to be processed.
